alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 2:17PM MST until December 29 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and patchy blowing snow. New snow accumulations generally ranging between 2 and 6 inches, with locally higher amounts above 7000 feet. Southwest winds gusting to 30 mph at times, leading to patchy blowing snow. * WHERE...Areas near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Ganado, Pinetop- Lakeside, Show Low, Whiteriver, and Window Rock. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Slippery and snow covered roads could lead to very difficult travel. Patchy blowing snow could reduce visibility at times. Hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Additional snow forecast through 5 AM Wednesday: Alpine 2 to 4 inches. Buffalo Pass 6 to 9 inches. Ganado 2 to 4 inches. Pinetop-Lakeside 4 to 8 inches. Show Low 3 to 5 inches. Whiteriver 1 to 2 inches. Window Rock 2 to 4 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; White Mountains
